data.title: Obituary of Andrew Paul Randolph
data.meta_description:

data.text: Andrew Paul Randolph "Knuckle" Age 27. Suddenly Friday, June 17, 2016 at his home. Born in Joliet, the son of Roger and Kim (nee Lindquist) Randolph, he was a lifelong resident. Graduate of Joliet West High School. Formerly employed by NCR and currently with AMS Seals in Plainfield. Member of the South Wilmington Fireman's Beach Club. Andy was a motorcycle enthusiast and very mechanically inclined, working on building a truck. He enjoyed camping, fishing and was a loving father who loved participating in his daughter's activities. Survived are his two daughters, Ava Rose and Bree Victoria; his loving parents, Roger "Butch" "Boots" and Kim Randolph of Sevierville, TN; one sister, Kelly (Marcus) Wright of Joliet; one brother, Matthew Randolph of St. Petersburg, FL; the mother of his children, Amanda Newman of Manhattan, IL; maternal grandmother, Charlotte Lindquist of Joliet; paternal grandmother, Rosemary (Ray) Conroy of Minooka; dearest nephew of Beth Siebers of Joliet, Kim (Skip) Eller of Wilmington and Lori (Brian) McNamee of Channahon. Preceded by his infant daughter, Brooke Victoria (2009); maternal grandfather, Robert Lindquist (1995); and paternal grandfather, Roger Randolph (2016). A Memorial Service for Andy will be held Wednesday, June 22, 2016 at 11:30 a.m. at the Fred C. Dames Funeral Home, 3200 Black at Essington Rds., Joliet. Memorials in his name to his daughter's education fund that will be established at a later date would be appreciated. Visitation Tuesday, 2-8 p.m. For more information: (815) 741-5500 or visit his Book of Memories at www.fredcdames.com
